values.content:
=You are an analyst extracting structured supply-chain risk signals from news articles.
Return STRICT JSON only (no prose). Do not invent facts. If unknown, use null.

INPUT
- INPUT_JSON is a JSON array. Each element has fields like:
  { "id", "title", "description", "publishedAt", "source", "url" }

TASK (apply to every element of INPUT_JSON independently):
1) Classify disruption type(s): ["Physical","Cyber","Trade/Geopolitical","Infrastructure/Transport"].
2) Extract impacted nodes (ports, canals, rail corridors, factories, borders) with country.
3) Map countries to ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 codes. If multiple countries, return all.
4) Assess scope: "Local" | "Regional" | "Global".
5) Assess economic importance of the main node: "High" | "Medium" | "Low".
6) Identify trade dependency context: "High" | "Medium" | "Low".
7) Estimate population/countries impacted (bucketed):
   PopImpactBucket ‚àà ["Minimal","City","State/Province","National","Multi-country"].
8) Provide a ‚â§25-word impact summary focused on supply-chain consequences.

SCORING (0‚Äì10, integers allowed; use 0 when truly unknown):
- ScopeScore: None/Irrelevant=1, Local=1, State/Province=3, Regional(multi-province)=5, Multi-country(2‚Äì3)=7, Global(‚â•4)=9‚Äì10.
- NodeImportanceScore: High(critical/global hub)=9‚Äì10, Medium=5, Low=1, None/Unknown=0.
- RiskTypeScore (max if multiple): Cyber=9‚Äì10, Trade/Geopolitical=8, Infrastructure/Transport=5, Physical=3, None/Unknown=0.
- TradeDependencyScore: High=9‚Äì10, Medium=5, Low=1, None/Unknown=0.
- PopulationImpactScore: Minimal=0, City=2, State/Province=4, National=7, Multi-country=9‚Äì10.

Also compute:
- SuggestedModelScore (0‚Äì10) = 0.25*Scope + 0.25*NodeImportance + 0.20*RiskType + 0.20*TradeDependency + 0.10*PopulationImpact.
- Confidence (0‚Äì1).
- EvidenceFieldsUsed: subset of ["title","description"].

CONSTRAINTS
- Be conservative; if speculative/outdated: lower ScopeScore or set "is_speculative": true.
- If the event looks minor but the headline is sensational, cap SuggestedModelScore ‚â§ 4.
- Prefer title + description. 

OUTPUT
Return ONLY a JSON array. Each array element MUST correspond 1:1 to an input item and MUST include the same "id".
Schema for each element:
{
  "id": "<copy from input>",
  "risk_types": ["Physical" | "Cyber" | "Trade/Geopolitical" | "Infrastructure/Transport", ...],
  "scope": "Local" | "Regional" | "Global" | null,
  "impacted_nodes": [{"name":"...", "type":"port|canal|rail|factory|border|road|airport|other", "country":"...", "iso2":".."}] | [],
  "countries_impacted": ["US","IN", ...] | [],
  "economic_importance": "High" | "Medium" | "Low" | null,
  "trade_dependency": "High" | "Medium" | "Low" | null,
  "population_impact_bucket": "Minimal" | "City" | "State/Province" | "National" | "Multi-country" | null,
  "impact_summary": "...",
  "scores": {
    "scope_score": 0,
    "node_importance_score": 0,
    "risk_type_score": 0,
    "trade_dependency_score": 0,
    "population_impact_score": 0,
    "suggested_model_score": 0
  },
  "confidence": 0.0,
  "is_speculative": false,
  "evidence_fields_used": ["title","description"]
}

INPUT_JSON = {{ JSON.stringify($json.items) }}

parameters.content: Reads last published date from ‚ÄúState‚Äù sheet to avoid refetching old news.
Queries NewsAPI for recent, supply chain‚Äìrelated disruptions since the last fetch date.
Cleans URLs, strips trackers, and creates a stable hashed id for deduplication.
Sends article details to Google Gemini to extract disruption type, impacted nodes, scope, and scores.
Duplicates rows so each impacted country has its own record.
Saves structured, scored data into ‚ÄúNEWS ‚Üí Staging‚Äù sheet keyed by row_id.

## üìå Note: 

This workflow is the data ingestion & pre-processing (ETL) layer for the Looker Studio dashboard ‚Äî automates news collection, enrichment, and staging for visualization.

=You are an analyst extracting structured supply-chain risk signals from news articles.
Return STRICT JSON only (no prose). Do not invent facts. If unknown, use null.

INPUT
- INPUT_JSON is a JSON array. Each element has fields like:

TASK (apply to every element of INPUT_JSON independently):
1) Classify disruption type(s): ["Physical","Cyber","Trade/Geopolitical","Infrastructure/Transport"].
2) Extract impacted nodes (ports, canals, rail corridors, factories, borders) with country.
3) Map countries to ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 codes. If multiple countries, return all.
4) Assess scope: "Local" | "Regional" | "Global".
5) Assess economic importance of the main node: "High" | "Medium" | "Low".
6) Identify trade dependency context: "High" | "Medium" | "Low".
7) Estimate population/countries impacted (bucketed):
   PopImpactBucket ‚àà ["Minimal","City","State/Province","National","Multi-country"].
8) Provide a ‚â§25-word impact summary focused on supply-chain consequences.

SCORING (0‚Äì10, integers allowed; use 0 when truly unknown):
- ScopeScore: None/Irrelevant=1, Local=1, State/Province=3, Regional(multi-province)=5, Multi-country(2‚Äì3)=7, Global(‚â•4)=9‚Äì10.
- NodeImportanceScore: High(critical/global hub)=9‚Äì10, Medium=5, Low=1, None/Unknown=0.
- RiskTypeScore (max if multiple): Cyber=9‚Äì10, Trade/Geopolitical=8, Infrastructure/Transport=5, Physical=3, None/Unknown=0.
- TradeDependencyScore: High=9‚Äì10, Medium=5, Low=1, None/Unknown=0.
- PopulationImpactScore: Minimal=0, City=2, State/Province=4, National=7, Multi-country=9‚Äì10.

Also compute:
- SuggestedModelScore (0‚Äì10) = 0.25*Scope + 0.25*NodeImportance + 0.20*RiskType + 0.20*TradeDependency + 0.10*PopulationImpact.
- Confidence (0‚Äì1).
- EvidenceFieldsUsed: subset of ["title","description","content"].

- Be conservative; if speculative/outdated: lower ScopeScore or set "is_speculative": true.
- If the event looks minor but the headline is sensational, cap SuggestedModelScore ‚â§ 4.
- Prefer title + description. If content is long, read only the first ~1000 characters.

OUTPUT
Return ONLY a JSON array. Each array element MUST correspond 1:1 to an input item and MUST include the same "id".
Schema for each element:
{
  "id": "<copy from input>",
  "risk_types": ["Physical" | "Cyber" | "Trade/Geopolitical" | "Infrastructure/Transport", ...],
  "scope": "Local" | "Regional" | "Global" | null,
  "impacted_nodes": [{"name":"...", "type":"port|canal|rail|factory|border|road|airport|other", "country":"...", "iso2":".."}] | [],
  "countries_impacted": ["US","IN", ...] | [],
  "economic_importance": "High" | "Medium" | "Low" | null,
  "trade_dependency": "High" | "Medium" | "Low" | null,
  "population_impact_bucket": "Minimal" | "City" | "State/Province" | "National" | "Multi-country" | null,
  "impact_summary": "...",
  "scores": {
    "scope_score": 0,
    "node_importance_score": 0,
    "risk_type_score": 0,
    "trade_dependency_score": 0,
    "population_impact_score": 0,
    "suggested_model_score": 0
  },
  "confidence": 0.0,
  "is_speculative": false,
  "evidence_fields_used": ["title","description"]
}

2) Extract impacted nodes (ports, canals, rail corridors, factories, borders) with country.
3) Map countries to ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 codes. If multiple countries, return all.
4) Assess scope: "Local" | "Regional" | "Global".
5) Assess economic importance of the main node: "High" | "Medium" | "Low".
6) Identify trade dependency context: "High" | "Medium" | "Low".
7) Estimate population/countries impacted (bucketed):
   PopImpactBucket ‚àà ["Minimal","City","State/Province","National","Multi-country"].
8) Provide a ‚â§25-word impact summary focused on supply-chain consequences.

SCORING (0‚Äì10, integers allowed; use 0 when truly unknown):
- ScopeScore: None/Irrelevant=1, Local=1, State/Province=3, Regional(multi-province)=5, Multi-country(2‚Äì3)=7, Global(‚â•4)=9‚Äì10.
- NodeImportanceScore: High(critical/global hub)=9‚Äì10, Medium=5, Low=1, None/Unknown=0.
- RiskTypeScore (max if multiple): Cyber=9‚Äì10, Trade/Geopolitical=8, Infrastructure/Transport=5, Physical=3, None/Unknown=0.
- TradeDependencyScore: High=9‚Äì10, Medium=5, Low=1, None/Unknown=0.
- PopulationImpactScore: Minimal=0, City=2, State/Province=4, National=7, Multi-country=9‚Äì10.

Also compute:
- SuggestedModelScore (0‚Äì10) = 0.25*Scope + 0.25*NodeImportance + 0.20*RiskType + 0.20*TradeDependency + 0.10*PopulationImpact.
- Confidence (0‚Äì1).
- EvidenceFieldsUsed: subset of ["title","description","content"].

CONSTRAINTS
- Be conservative; if speculative/outdated: lower ScopeScore or set "is_speculative": true.
- If the event looks minor but the headline is sensational, cap SuggestedModelScore ‚â§ 4.
- Prefer title + description. If content is long, read only the first ~1000 characters.

OUTPUT
Return ONLY a JSON array. Each array element MUST correspond 1:1 to an input item and MUST include the same "id".
Schema for each element:
{
  "id": "<copy from input>",
  "risk_types": ["Physical" | "Cyber" | "Trade/Geopolitical" | "Infrastructure/Transport", ...],
  "scope": "Local" | "Regional" | "Global" | null,
  "impacted_nodes": [{"name":"...", "type":"port|canal|rail|factory|border|road|airport|other", "country":"...", "iso2":".."}] | [],
  "countries_impacted": ["US","IN", ...] | [],
  "economic_importance": "High" | "Medium" | "Low" | null,
  "trade_dependency": "High" | "Medium" | "Low" | null,
  "population_impact_bucket": "Minimal" | "City" | "State/Province" | "National" | "Multi-country" | null,
  "impact_summary": "...",
  "scores": {
    "scope_score": 0,
    "node_importance_score": 0,
    "risk_type_score": 0,
    "trade_dependency_score": 0,
    "population_impact_score": 0,
    "suggested_model_score": 0
  },
  "confidence": 0.0,
  "is_speculative": false,
  "evidence_fields_used": ["title","description"]
}

parameters.jsonOutput:
={
  "engine": "google_news_light",
  "q": "(\"supply chain\" OR \"logistics\") AND (\"port strike\" OR \"border closure\" OR \"trade embargo\" OR \"maritime blockade\" OR \"shipping delay\" OR \"container shortage\" OR \"port congestion\" OR \"rail strike\" OR \"airport closure\" OR \"factory shutdown\" OR \"plant fire\" OR \"labour strike\" OR \"industrial accident\" OR \"cyber attack\" OR \"ransomware\" OR \"IT outage\" OR \"storm damage\" OR \"flooding\" OR \"hurricane\" OR \"earthquake\")",
  "hl": "en",
  "gl": "in",
  "google_domain": "google.com",
  "device": "desktop",
  "num": 100,
  "start": 0,
  "no_cache": false,
"daysSinceLast": "{{ Math.max(0, Math.floor((Date.now() - Date.parse($json['Last PublishedAt'])) / 86400000)) }}",
}
